description.narrative: Special protection measures developed and implemented to provide care, support and protection for the most vulnerable children, including exploited and trafficked children, children without parental care, children affected by HIV/AIDS and children with disabilities

mailing-address.narrative: No. 81 A Tran Quoc Toan Ha Noi Viet Nam

sector.narrative: Alternative care reform and service provision
Child protection focused on care and support for children with disabilities
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
HSS - Risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Legal and policy framework related to violence, exploitation and abuse
Protective services for children on the move
Public finance management for child protection
Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Technical assistance - Prevention and response services for violence against children

description.narrative: Justice, Law and Order human rights affairs
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace

2018 Vietnam: External After Action Review of the Government of Viet Nam and UNICEF emergency response supporting children and women in 10 provinces in Viet Nam affected by drought and salt water intrusion crisis (2016-2017)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Special protection measures developed and implemented to provide care, support and protection for the most vulnerable children, including exploited and trafficked children, children without parental care, children affected by HIV/AIDS and children with disabilities

description.narrative: Stronger commitment, improved knowledge and refined policy frameworks have been put in place for the care, support and protection of the most vulnerable children, including exploited and trafficked children, children without parental care, children with disabilities and children in emergencies. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: Number of new national policies, programmes or standards to support implementation of the Hague Convention submitted to the Government of Viet Nam by MOJ and approved

baseline.value: 0 (2012) (i.e. Viet Nam ratified the Hague Convention in 2012 but has no national project to guide its implementation)

title.narrative: Number of sub-laws, guidelines or standards with specific provisions guiding the implementation related to children of the Law on Persons with Disabilities submitted by MOLISA to the Government of Viet Nam

baseline.value: 0 (2012) (i.e. laws on persons with disabilities exist but no sub-laws to guide the implementation of the laws)

title.narrative: Number of new national policies, guidelines and standards on prevention of and protection from child exploitation submitted by MOLISA/MPS/MD to the Government of Viet Nam

baseline.value: 0 (i.e. National Plan of Action against Human Trafficking, 2012-2015 approved without projects to guide its implementation)

target.value: 2014:3 (i.e. project on reintegration support for trafficked victims (2013), and project on communication on prevention of human trafficking (2013) and decree and circulars to guide the implementation of t

actual.value: 2014:A Circular on ‘Financial Support for Victims' Repatriation, Reception and Reintegration', and a Circular ‘Guiding the implementation of the Decree on implementation of the Anti -Human Trafficking Law' were issued by Ministry of Finance and Investment and Ministry of Labour, Invalids and Social Affai

title.narrative: Number of new guidelines on community-based alternative child care (i.e. respite care for vulnerable children and foster care) issued by MOLISA

baseline.value: 0 (i.e. no guidelines on respite care for vulnerable children, or for foster care are available)

actual.value:
2014:A Guideline on Foster Care is finalised.
Guidelines on Respite Day Care model is also under development by the Ministry of Labour, Invalids and Social Affairs.
Guideline on case management for CWD is being developed.

title.narrative: Issuance of a revised national policy on social assistance, including Decrees 67/13with an expanded target group including poor and vulnerable children and increased level of support by the Government of Viet Nam

baseline.value: Not issued (2012) (i.e. decrees 67/13 had a low level of support and coverage for poor and vulnerable children)
